A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: SO many haters. This is miles away the best movie not in the OG trilogy. It stays away from repeating itself while keeping the message and ethos intact while setting up a huge future of opportunity and new characters for the next generation. This trilogy is clearly about growth and learning from the past and being open for change and the future. It's a breathe of fresh air and has some of the best battles they've done.
